column7: ENV's governance structure enables ongoing opportunity identification and improvement reflecting the transitional risks associated with emissions, which includes managing a dynamic reporting environment. It is aligned with the Paris Agreement framework (and associated Greenhouse Gas (GHG) Protocols.

Delegation of authority begins with shareholders. Shareholders are the company's owners and have the right to oversee its activities; the board of directors can then delegate authority to board committees, such as the nominating and remuneration committee, the audit committee, and the risk and sustainability committee. These committees are responsible for overseeing specific areas of the company's activities. The board of directors can delegate authority to the company's management.
